meanings.definition: A unit of magnetomotive force in the centimeter-gram-second system, equal to 0.7958 ampere-turns.
meanings.sent1: The electromagnet required 5 gilberts to function properly.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the magnetic field in gilberts.
meanings.sent3: The gilberts in the lab seemed to have a magnetic personality.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for science was like a surge of gilberts, pulling everyone in.
meanings.sent5: The concept of gilberts stuck in his mind like a powerful magnet.

meanings.definition: A unit of magnetomotive force in the meter-kilogram-second system, equal to 10/4π ampere-turns.
meanings.sent1: The new generator produced 3 gilberts of magnetic force.
meanings.sent2: The magnetic field strength was measured in gilberts.
meanings.sent3: The gilberts in the experiment seemed to have a magnetic attraction to each other.
meanings.sent4: His words carried a gilberts of influence, shaping opinions effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The gilberts of energy in the room made it feel alive and buzzing.
